content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an implementation of the function `extract_julia_code`:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks in markdown document
    code_blocks = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, 1))
    
    if isempty(code_blocks)
        return ""
    end

    # Concatenate all code blocks together with newline
    result = join([split(block.captures[1], "\n")[2:end] for block in code_blocks], "\n\n")
    
    return result
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to find all occurrences of Julia language code blocks in the markdown document. It then concatenates these blocks together with newline characters, removing the initial and trailing newlines that are included as part of the code block structure. The resulting string is returned by the function. If there are no code blocks in the document, an empty string is returned.
